questions.text: What is an array in programming?
options: A single variable that can hold multiple values of different data types
A collection of elements of the same data type, stored in contiguous memory locations

questions.text: The size of an array can be changed dynamically at any time after it has been created.
In most programming languages, the index of the first element in an array is:
If an array is declared as `int numbers[5];`, what is the index of the last element?
An 'Array Index Out of Bounds' error occurs when you try to access an element at an index that does not exist.
How would you access the third element in an array named `scores`?
What does the `length` or `size` property of an array typically represent?
options: The index of the last element
The total number of elements the array can hold
The value of the first element
The amount of memory the array uses

questions.text: All elements in a single array must be of the same data type.
A two-dimensional array can be thought of as a:
options: A table with rows and columns

questions.text: Which loop is commonly used to iterate through all the elements of an array?
Initializing an array means assigning it a name and data type.
In a 2D array `matrix[3][4]`, how would you access the element in the first row and second column?
What is the term for a single item stored within an array?
The index of an array element is used to specify its position.
If an array has a length of 10, what is the valid range of indices?
What is a 'sparse array'?
options: An array where most of the elements have a value of zero
An array that can only hold a few elements
An array that cannot be changed

questions.text: Arrays are stored in non-contiguous memory locations, meaning elements can be scattered randomly in memory.
What is the primary advantage of using an array?
options: They are highly flexible in size
They provide fast, random access to elements using an index
They can store elements of mixed data types

questions.text: In the declaration `String[] names = {"Ali", "Bob", "Charlie"};`, what is `names[1]`?
The process of placing elements into an array is called 'declaration'.
An array of arrays is also known as a:
What is a primary disadvantage of arrays in many languages?
options: They have a fixed size upon creation
They are difficult to loop through

questions.text: A 'for-each' or 'enhanced for' loop can be used to iterate through an array without using an index variable.
If `data = [10, 20, 30, 40]`, what happens if you try to access `data[4]`?
options: It will return the last element, 40
It will cause an index out of bounds error
It will return a null value

questions.text: An 'associative array' or 'dictionary', unlike a standard array, uses _____ instead of integers to index its elements.
Searching for an element in an unsorted array typically requires checking each element one by one.
The number used to access a specific element in an array is called the:
You can have an array of strings, an array of integers, or an array of booleans.
